me.pagekite.glen3b.library.bukkit.scoreboard

Class AbstractBoardManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.pagekite.glen3b.library.bukkit.scoreboard.ScorelessBoardManager
      • me.pagekite.glen3b.library.bukkit.scoreboard.AbstractBoardManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Listener

    public abstract class AbstractBoardManager
extends ScorelessBoardManager
implements Listener
    Represents an abstract scoreboard manager, which implements a skeletal framework for scoreboards. The entry calculation is still delegated to subclasses.

    This class does automatically assign the player a generated scoreboard upon joining, and destroys the board upon player leaving. Therefore, statistical changes for dynamic values are guaranteed to appear. The event listener registration for this to happen does not automatically happen in the constructor. Therefore, event registration must be done by the calling plugin by calling the registerEvents() method.

    Author:
    Glen Husman

      • resetScoreboard

        public void resetScoreboard(Player player)
        Resets the scoreboard of the specified player, causing it to be recreated upon the next retrieval of that player's scoreboard. Also sets the player to view the main server scoreboard, guaranteeing that updates to be made will be seen.
        Overrides:
        resetScoreboard in class ScorelessBoardManager
        Parameters:
        player - The player for whom to reset the scoreboard.

protected abstract java.lang.String getTitle(Player player)

      • getTitlePrefix

        @Nullable
protected java.lang.String getTitlePrefix(Player player)
        Gets the prefix to the title of the scoreboard for the specified player. The default implementation of this method always returns null.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who will be displayed the title.
        Returns:
        A string representing the title prefix of the specified player's scoreboard, or null if there is no prefix.

      • schedule

        protected void schedule(java.util.Collection<? extends java.lang.Runnable> tasks)
        Description copied from class: ScorelessBoardManager
        Schedules multiple tasks to run under a parent plugin. All tasks will be for scoreboard text cycling. This method may use any interval for the desired UI appearance, but the tasks must be repeating and executed on the main thread.
        Specified by:
        schedule in class ScorelessBoardManager
        Parameters:
        tasks - The tasks to schedule.

      • getSidebarEntries

      • prepareScoreboard

        protected ScoreboardInformation prepareScoreboard(Player player)
        Description copied from class: ScorelessBoardManager
        Prepares a scoreboard for the specified player. Only called when a cached scoreboard is not available. To force a call to this method, ScorelessBoardManager.resetScoreboard(Player) may be called.
        Specified by:
        prepareScoreboard in class ScorelessBoardManager
        Parameters:
        player - The player who will own the scoreboard.
        Returns:
        A set of scoreboard entries that represents the player scoreboard. The iteration order of the collection containted in the returned object must represent the order of scoreboard entries, from top to bottom, to display to the player.
